definitions.definition: An inhabitant of a place; one who dwells in.
definitions.example: The giant squid is one of many denizens of the deep.
The denizens of that pub are of the roughest sort.

definitions.definition: A person with rights between those of naturalized citizen and resident alien (roughly permanent resident), obtained through letters patent.
definitions.example: Though born in Iceland, he became a denizen of Britain after leaving Oxford.

definitions.definition: An animal or plant from a particular range or habitat.
definitions.example: The bald eagle is a denizen of the northern part of the state.

definitions.definition: A foreign word that has become naturalised in another language.
To grant rights of citizenship to; to naturalize.
definitions.example: He was denizened to Ireland after fleeing his home country.

definitions.definition: To provide with denizens; to populate with adopted or naturalized occupants.
